<TR>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="5%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	8.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="95%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 2.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Westbroek was appointed the Vice President Sales &amp; Marketing effective July 29, 2011. All figures in this summary compensation table prior to such date reflects the compensation paid to Mr. Westbroek in euros in his capacity as Vice-President and General Manager of the Company&#8217;s Belgian based OnSite Generation business.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="5%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	9.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="95%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 2.5PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Smeets was appointed as General Manager of the Company&#8217;s Belgian based OnSite Generation business on April 4, 2011.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="5%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	10.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="95%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.15PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Each PSU granted in fiscal year 2012 for all named executive officers are valued at the market value at the date of grant.&#160;&#160;For all named executive officers other than Mr. Motz the PSU grant was valued at $6.25. Mr. Motz&#8217;s PSU grant was valued at $6.60 per PSU.&#160;&#160;This method is identical to the method used for financial reporting purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
<TR>
<TD ALIGN="LEFT" VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="5%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	11.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
<TD VALIGN="TOP" WIDTH="95%" STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 1.15PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Based on the Black-Scholes valuation methodology. Each stock option granted in fiscal year 2012 for all named executive officers other than Mr. Motz was valued at $3.79. Mr. Motz&#8217;s stock option grant was valued at $3.97 per option granted.&#160;&#160;Black-scholes valuation methodology is a typical market approach in valuing options. This method is identical to the method for used for financial reporting purposes.
</FONT>
</DIV>
</TD>
</TR>
</TABLE>
</DIV>

</EFX_UNIDENTIFIED_TABLE>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<BR>
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For 2012, each of our directors who is considered &#8220;independent&#8221; was paid an annual fee of $27,000 for his services as a director and an attendance fee of $1,500 for each Board or committee meeting attended.&#160;&#160;Each committee chair received an annual fee of $34,000 and an additional attendance fee of $250 for each committee meeting attended.&#160;&#160;Our Chairman of the Board was paid an annual fee of $45,000 for his services and an attendance fee of $1,750 for each Board meeting attended.&#160;&#160;All directors were reimbursed for travel and other reasonable expenses incurred in attending Board and committee meetings.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Deferred Share Units
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Pursuant to the DSU Plan, independent directors are entitled to elect to receive all or any portion of their annual retainer and meeting fees in the form of DSUs instead of cash. A DSU is a right to receive a cash payment based on the value of a Share, credited by means of a book-keeping entry in the books of the Company, to an account in the name of the independent director. At the end of the director&#8217;s tenure as a member of the Board, the director is paid, in cash, the market value of the Shares represented by the DSUs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Board of Directors has approved the following annual DSU grants to independent directors:&#160;&#160;independent director &#8211; $15,000 equivalent in DSUs; Chair of the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee - $20,000 equivalent in DSUs; Chair of the Audit Committee - $20,000 equivalent in DSUs; and Chairman of the Board of Directors - $30,000 equivalent in DSUs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Contemporaneously with the adoption of the DSU Plan, the Board also established ownership guidelines for directors pursuant to which each non-employee director is required to hold Shares and/or DSUs equal to three times the director&#8217;s annual cash retainer within three years of initial appointment. The value of the directors&#8217; Shares or DSUs are measured at either the year-end Share price, or a director&#8217;s acquisition cost of Shares and initial grant price of DSU
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For compensation information regarding Mr. Cargnelli and Mr. Wilson, please see &#8220;Elements of Executive Compensation Program&#8221; above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Post-retirement Benefit Obligations
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For information regarding accrued post-retirement benefit obligations, see &#8220;Note 9. &#8211; Trade and Other Payables&#8221; to our consolidated financial statements, which can be found on page F-29 of this form, and is incorporated by reference herein.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	BOARD PRACTICES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For information regarding the period during which the directors and executive officers have served in office, see &#8220;Item 6. Directors, Senior Management and Employees &#8211; Directors and Senior Management&#8221; above.&#160;&#160;Each director elected will hold office until the next annual meeting of shareholders or until his successor is duly elected or appointed.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Termination and Change of Control Benefits of Executive Directors
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Wilson&#8217;s employment agreement provides that Mr. Wilson is entitled to 18 months&#8217; salary and bonus in lieu of notice if he is terminated without cause from his position at any time, or if he is terminated upon a change of control of the Company. This amount is equal to a maximum of approximately CA $888,750 based on Mr. Wilson&#8217;s current compensation. The agreement also provides that all outstanding stock options held by Mr. Wilson will immediately vest upon termination without cause or termination resulting from a change of control of the Company. Mr. Wilson has agreed to refrain from competing with and interfering in the business of Hydrogenics for a period of one year subsequent to his termination for any reason. Under both the Omnibus Plan and the Old RSU Plan, if Mr. Wilson&#8217;s employment is terminated by the Company without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded RSUs, then a pro rata portion of such RSUs will vest immediately prior to the date of his termination of employment. The value of such RSUs, as of December 31, 2012, is CA$735,676. Under the Omnibus Plan, if Mr. Wilson&#8217;s employment is terminated without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded PSUs, then all of Mr. Wilson&#8217;s unvested PSUs will vest in the normal course for a period of 90 days extending from the end of the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurred. Any PSUs which do not vest in the normal course during such 90 day period will, subject to Board approval, vest pro rata upon the date of termination. The value of Mr. Wilson&#8217;s PSUs, as at December 31, 2012, is CA $530,793.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Motz&#8217;s employment agreement provides that Mr. Motz is entitled to 12 months&#8217; salary and bonus in lieu of notice if Mr. Motz is terminated without cause from his position at any time, or if he is terminated upon a change of control of the Company.&#160;&#160;This amount is equal to a maximum of approximately CA $345,000 based on Mr. Motz&#8217;s current compensation.&#160;&#160;The agreement also provides that all outstanding stock options held by Mr. Motz will immediately vest upon termination without cause or termination resulting from a change of control of the Company. Mr. Motz has agreed to refrain from competing with and interfering in the business of Hydrogenics for a period of three years subsequent to his termination for any reason. Under both the Omnibus Plan and the Old RSU Plan, if Mr. Motz&#8217;s employment is terminated by the Company without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded RSUs, then a pro rata portion of such RSUs will vest immediately prior to the date of her termination of employment. The value of such RSUs, as of December 31, 2012, is Nil. Under the Omnibus Plan, if Mr. Motz&#8217;s employment is terminated without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded PSUs, then all of Mr. Motz&#8217;s unvested PSUs will vest in the normal course for a period of 90 days extending from the end of the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurred. Any PSUs which do not vest in the normal course during such 90 day period will, subject to Board approval, vest pro rata upon the date of termination. The value of Mr. Motz&#8217;s PSUs, as at December 31, 2012, is CA $229,500.
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="HDR">

	&#160;

<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hydrogenics Corporation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Ms. Barber was employed as Chief Financial Officer and Corporate Secretary of the Company from July 29, 2011 until her departure effective November 8, 2012.&#160;&#160;Ms. Barber&#8217;s employment agreement provided that Ms. Barber was entitled to 12 months&#8217; salary and bonus in lieu of notice if Ms. Barber was terminated without cause from her position at any time, or if she was terminated upon a change of control of the Company.&#160;&#160;This amount is equal to a maximum of approximately CA $315,000 based on Ms. Barber&#8217;s compensation as at the date of her resignation.&#160;&#160;The agreement also provided that all outstanding stock options held by Ms. Barber would immediately vest upon termination without cause or termination resulting from a change of control of the Company. Ms. Barber agreed to refrain from competing with and interfering in the business of Hydrogenics for a period of three years subsequent to her termination for any reason. Under both the Omnibus Plan and the Old RSU Plan, if Ms. Barber&#8217;s employment is terminated by the Company without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded RSUs, then a pro rata portion of such RSUs will vest immediately prior to the date of her termination of employment. The value of such RSUs, as of December 31, 2012, is CA $Nil.&#160;&#160;Under the Omnibus Plan, if Ms. Barber&#8217;s employment is terminated without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded PSUs, then all of Ms. Barber&#8217;s unvested PSUs will vest in the normal course for a period of 90 days extending from the end of the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurred. Any PSUs which do not vest in the normal course during such 90 day period will, subject to Board approval, vest pro rata upon the date of termination. The value of Ms. Barber&#8217;s PSUs, as at December 31, 2012, is CA $Nil.&#160;&#160;Ms. Barber&#8217;s employment with the Company ceased effective November 8, 2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Westbroek&#8217;s employment agreement provides that Mr. Westbroek is entitled to 12 months&#8217; salary and bonus in lieu of notice, if Mr. Westbroek is terminated without cause from his position at any time, or if he is terminated upon a change of control of the Company.&#160;&#160;This amount is equal to a maximum of approximately CA $309,000 based on Mr. Westbroek&#8217;s current compensation. The agreement also provides that all outstanding stock options held by Mr. Westbroek will immediately vest upon termination without cause or termination resulting from a change of control of the Company. Mr. Westbroek has agreed to refrain from competing with and interfering in the business of Hydrogenics for a period of one year subsequent to his termination for any reason. Under both the Omnibus Plan and the Old RSU Plan, if Mr. Westbroek&#8217;s employment is terminated by the Company without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded RSUs, then a pro rata portion of such RSUs will vest immediately prior to the date of his termination of employment. The value of such RSUs, as of December 31, 2012, is CA$162,965.&#160;&#160;Under the Omnibus Plan, if Mr. Westbroek&#8217;s employment is terminated without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded PSUs, then all of Mr. Westbroek&#8217;s unvested PSUs will vest in the normal course for a period of 90 days extending from the end of the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurred. Any PSUs which do not vest in the normal course during such 90 day period will, subject to Board approval, vest pro rata upon the date of termination. The value of Mr. Westbroek&#8217;s PSUs, as at December 31, 2012, is CA $120,434.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Cargnelli&#8217;s employment agreement provides that Mr. Cargnelli is entitled to 24 months&#8217; salary and one and a half times the average bonus paid in the two fiscal years preceding termination in lieu of notice if Mr. Cargnelli is terminated without cause from his position at any time, or if he is terminated upon a change of control of the Company.&#160;&#160;This amount is equal to a maximum of approximately CA $768,750 based on Mr. Cargnelli&#8217;s current compensation.&#160;&#160;Mr. Cargnelli has agreed to refrain from competing with and interfering in the business of Hydrogenics for a period of three years subsequent to his termination for any reason. Under both the Omnibus Plan and the Old RSU Plan, if Mr. Cargnelli&#8217;s employment is terminated by the Company without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded RSUs, then a pro rata portion of such RSUs will vest immediately prior to the date of his termination of employment. The value of such RSUs, as of December 31, 2012, is CA$381,807.&#160;&#160;Under the Omnibus Plan, if Mr. Cargnelli&#8217;s employment is terminated without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded PSUs, then all of Mr. Cargnelli&#8217;s unvested PSUs will vest in the normal course for a period of 90 days extending from the end of the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurred. Any PSUs which do not vest in the normal course during such 90 day period will, subject to Board approval, vest pro rata upon the date of termination. The value of Mr. Cargnelli&#8217;s PSUs, as at December 31, 2012, is CA $120,434.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hydrogenics Corporation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Smeets&#8217; employment agreement provides that if Mr. Smeets&#8217; employment is terminated prior to April 4, 2012, Mr. Smeets must be provided one month&#8217;s notice. If Mr. Smeets&#8217; employment is terminated subsequent to April 4, 2012, Mr. Smeets is entitled to one month&#8217;s notice plus an additional month per commenced year of employment, at a minimum of three and a maximum of six months&#8217; notice. Under no circumstances will the termination of Mr. Smeets&#8217; employment for any reason entitle Mr. Smeets to any form of damage compensation. Mr. Smeets has agreed to refrain from competing with and interfering in the business of Hydrogenics in Belgium for a period of one year subsequent to his termination for any reason. Under both the Omnibus Plan and the Old RSU Plan, if Mr. Smeets&#8217; employment is terminated by the Company without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded RSUs, then a pro rata portion of such RSUs will vest immediately prior to the date of his termination of employment. The value of such RSUs, as of December 31, 2012, is nil.&#160;&#160;Under the Omnibus Plan, if Mr. Smeets&#8217; employment is terminated without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded PSUs, then all of Mr. Smeets&#8217; unvested PSUs will vest in the normal course for a period of 90 days extending from the end of the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurred. Any PSUs which do not vest in the normal course during such 90 day period will, subject to Board approval, vest pro rata upon the date of termination. The value of Mr. Smeets&#8217; PSUs, as at December 31, 2012, is CA $nil.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Ms. Demerino&#8217;s employment agreement does not provide for any specific termination or change of control provisions. Under both the Omnibus Plan and the Old RSU Plan, if Ms. Demerino&#8217;s employment is terminated by the Company without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded RSUs, then a pro rata portion of such RSUs will vest immediately prior to the date of his termination of employment. The value of such RSUs, as of December 31, 2012, is nil.&#160;&#160;Under the Omnibus Plan, if Ms. Demerino&#8217;s employment is terminated without cause, prior to the vesting date of any awarded PSUs, then all of Ms. Demerino&#8217;s unvested PSUs will vest in the normal course for a period of 90 days extending from the end of the fiscal year in which the date of termination occurred. Any PSUs which do not vest in the normal course during such 90 day period will, subject to Board approval, vest pro rata upon the date of termination. The value of Ms. Demerino&#8217;s PSUs, as at December 31, 2012, is CA $nil.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Composition of Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The following individuals served as the members of the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee as at December 31, 2012 and March 8, 2013: Michael Cardiff (Chair), Douglas S. Alexander Henry Gnacke and Norman M. Seagram.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Each member of the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee is independent under tests established by legal and stock exchange requirements to which the Company is subject.&#160;&#160;None of the members of the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee is an officer, employee or former officer or employee of the Company or any of its affiliates.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	For details with respect to each member of the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee&#8217;s experience relating to executive compensation matters, see &#8220;Directors and Senior Management&#8221; above.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Nomination of Directors and Compensation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Annually, the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee assesses the size of the Board of Directors, the competencies, skills and qualities required of the Board of Directors in order to add value to the Company, and the competencies, skills and qualities of existing directors.&#160;&#160;Based on this assessment, the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee will consider whether to recommend any changes to the composition of the Board of Directors, including proposing nominations to the Board for approval.&#160;&#160;When required, the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee will evaluate potential candidates for serving as a director with regard to the background, employment and qualifications of possible candidates and will consider whether the candidate&#8217;s competencies, skills and qualities are aligned with the Company&#8217;s needs.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hydrogenics Corporation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">
</DIV>

</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In fulfilling its charter, the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee&#8217;s role also includes reviewing and reporting to the Board on: human resource planning, including the terms of the compensation packages provided to the Company&#8217;s employees; succession planning and senior management appointments; the levels and form of executive compensation in general; and the specific compensation of senior executives, including the annual compensation of the President and Chief Executive Officer. The committee also administers the Omnibus Plan, the Old Option Plan, the Old RSU Plan and the DSU Plan and reviews and makes recommendations to the Board regarding the annual compensation of non-employee directors.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

</DIV>

</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage65"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hydrogenics Corporation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Report of the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee ensures the Company develops and implements an effective and efficient approach to corporate governance and has a plan for the continuity of its officers and an executive compensation plan that is motivational and competitive, which will attract, retain and inspire executive management and other key personnel.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The committee ensures the Company&#8217;s business and affairs are carried out in a transparent manner that will enhance shareholder value.&#160;&#160;The committee assesses the effectiveness of the Company&#8217;s corporate governance processes and compensation policies and, where appropriate, makes recommendations with respect to the implementation, development and modification with respect to these processes and policies.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In 2012, the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee, in fulfilling its responsibilities, took the following measures:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and approved, on an aggregate basis, the total compensation of all employees of the Corporation and all subsidiaries of the Corporation;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and approved corporate goals and objectives relevant to Chief Executive Officer compensation, evaluated the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s performance in light of those goals and objectives, and set the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s compensation level based on this evaluation;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s evaluation of the performance of the other officers of the Corporation and such other senior management and key employees of the Corporation or any subsidiary of the Corporation as identified to the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee by the Board (collectively, the &#8220;Designated Executives&#8221;) and reviewed the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s recommendations with respect to the amount of compensation to be paid to the Designated Executives;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and assessed the competitiveness and appropriateness of, and approved the compensation package of, each of the Designated Executives;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and approved any employment contracts or arrangements with each of the Designated Executives, including any retiring allowance arrangements or any similar arrangements to take effect in the event of a termination of employment;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and recommended to the Board compensation policies and processes and, in particular, the compensation policies and processes for the Designated Executives;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;in determining the long-term incentive component of the Chief Executive Officer&#8217;s compensation and each Designated Executive&#8217;s compensation, considered the Corporation&#8217;s performance and relative shareholder return, the value of similar incentive awards to executives at comparable companies, and the awards given to executives of the Corporation in past years;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;made recommendations to the Board with respect to incentive compensation and equity-based plans, including the design and adoption of the Omnibus Plan, and reviewed and made recommendations with respect to the performance or operating goals for participants in such plans;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;administered, approved and ratified awards under incentive compensation and stock plans, including amendments to the awards made under any such plans, and reviewed and monitored awards under such plans;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;made recommendations to the Board regarding the annual compensation of non-employee directors;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and reported to the Board on the appropriateness of the succession planning of the Corporation, including appointing, training and monitoring senior management;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed the significant human resources policies, plans and programs of the Corporation to ensure they are supportive of the Corporation&#8217;s near and long-term strategies; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;undertook on behalf of, and in an advisory capacity to, the Board such other initiatives as were considered necessary or desirable to assist the Board in discharging its responsibility to ensure appropriate human resources development, performance evaluation, compensation and management development programs are in place and operating effectively.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 62
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>
</DIV>
<A NAME="eolPage66"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hydrogenics Corporation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee met 4 times in 2012. The Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee is satisfied that it has fulfilled its charter during the year ended December 31, 2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Other Committee Assessments
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee is responsible for supervising the assessment of the effectiveness of the Board of Directors as a whole and each committee of the Board of Directors, for evaluating the performance of the Chairman of the Board, the Chair of each committee and the performance and contribution of individual directors.&#160;&#160;The process generally involves the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee assigning the task of conducting a survey of directors (with respect to their views on the effectiveness of the Board of Directors, Chairman of the Board, each committee of the Board and its Chair and individual directors).&#160;&#160;The form of the survey is approved by the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee. The results of the survey are communicated in writing to the Chairman of the Board and the Chairman then reports the overall results and the Chairman&#8217;s recommendations to the Board.&#160;&#160;The Chairman also meets in person or by telephone with each Board member to confidentially discuss his peer evaluation.&#160;&#160;The Chairman also meets with the Chair of the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee to review the results of the survey prior to the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee meeting to finalize its recommendations for Board and committee nominations.&#160;&#160;The Chair of the Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee meets with the Chairman of the Board to discuss the Chairman&#8217;s performance assessment.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Human Resources and Corporate Governance Committee administers the Company&#8217;s executive compensation program for executive officers, including the Named Executive Officers.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Audit Committee
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Our Board of Directors has delegated to the Audit Committee responsibility for assisting the Board in its oversight role with respect to the quality and integrity of financial information and reporting disclosure, risk management, the performance, qualifications and independence of the external auditors and legal and regulatory compliance.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee regularly meets in camera to review management&#8217;s financial stewardship.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee consists entirely of unrelated, independent and financially literate directors.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	During the past year, the Audit Committee, in fulfilling its responsibilities, took the following measures:
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and discussed with management and the registered public accountants the Corporation&#8217;s annual audited consolidated financial statements, including disclosures made in management&#8217;s discussion and analysis (&#8220;MD&amp;A&#8221;) and recommend to the Board whether the audited consolidated financial statements should be included in the Corporation&#8217;s annual report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and discussed with management and the registered public accountants the Corporation&#8217;s quarterly consolidated financial statements, including disclosures made under the MD&amp;A or similar disclosures, prior to the filing of its quarterly report;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and discussed with management and the registered public accountants the financial information and consolidated financial statements contained in any prospectus, registration statement, annual information form, circular or other material disclosure document of the Corporation, in each case, prior to the filing of such documents;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed and discussed with management and the registered public accountants, as applicable: (i) major issues regarding accounting principles and consolidated financial statement presentations, including any significant changes in the Corporation&#8217;s selection or application of accounting principles, and major issues as to the adequacy of the Corporation&#8217;s internal controls and any special audit steps adopted in light of material control deficiencies; (ii) analyses prepared by management or the registered public accountants setting forth significant financial reporting issues and judgments made in connection with the preparation of the consolidated financial statements, including analyses of the effects of alternative International Financial Reporting Standards (&#8220;IFRS&#8221;) methods on the consolidated financial statements; (iii) any management letter provided by the registered public accountants and the Corporation&#8217;s response to that letter; (iv) any problems, difficulties or differences encountered in the course of the audit work, including any disagreements with management or restrictions on the scope of the registered public accountants&#8217; activities or on access to requested information and management&#8217;s response thereto; (v) the effect of regulatory and accounting initiatives, as well as off-balance sheet structures, on the consolidated financial statements of the Corporation; and (vi) earnings press releases, as well as financial information and earnings guidance (generally or on a case-by-case basis) provided to analysts and rating agencies;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hydrogenics Corporation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;discussed with management the Corporation&#8217;s major financial risk exposures and the steps management has taken to monitor and control such exposures, including the Corporation&#8217;s risk assessment and risk management policies;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;obtained and reviewed a report from the registered public accountants regarding: (i) the registered public accountants&#8217; internal quality control procedures; (ii) any material issues raised by the most recent quality control review, or peer review, of the firm, or by any inquiry or investigation by governmental or professional authorities within the preceding five years respecting one or more independent audits carried out by the firm; (iii) any steps taken to deal with any such issues; and (iv) all relationships between the registered public accountants and the Corporation;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;evaluated the qualifications, performance and independence of the registered public accountants, including a review and evaluation of the lead partner of the registered public accountants and taking into account the opinions of management;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;ensured that the lead audit partner of the registered public accountants and the audit partner responsible for reviewing the audit are rotated at least every five years as required by SOX;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;discussed with management and the registered public accountants any accounting adjustments that were noted or proposed by the registered public accountants but were passed (as immaterial or otherwise);
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;established procedures for: (i) the receipt, retention and treatment of complaints received by the Corporation regarding accounting, internal accounting controls or auditing matters; and (ii) the confidential, anonymous submission by employees of the Corporation of concerns regarding questionable accounting or auditing matters;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed disclosures made by the Corporation&#8217;s principal executive officer or officers and principal financial officer or officers regarding compliance with their certification obligations as required under SOX and the rules promulgated there under, including the Corporation&#8217;s disclosure controls and procedures and internal controls for financial reporting and evaluations thereof;
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed with management and approved the Corporation&#8217;s investment policies for its securities portfolio and reviewed the portfolio management performance; and
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	&#8226;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;&#160;reviewed the performances of the Chief Financial Officer and other senior executives involved in the financial reporting process, reviewed financial and accounting personnel succession planning within the Corporation and, where possible, consulted on the appointment of, or departure of, individuals occupying these positions.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Audit Committee met 5 times in 2012. The Audit Committee is satisfied that it has fulfilled its charter during the year ended December 31, 2012.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Audit Committee of our Board of Directors operates under a written charter that sets out its responsibilities and composition requirements.&#160;&#160;As at December 31, 2012 and March 8, 2013, the members of the committee were: Norman M. Seagram (Chair), Douglas S. Alexander and Michael Cardiff.&#160;&#160;The following sets out the education and experience of each director relevant to the performance of his duties as a member of the committee.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Norman M. Seagram is Chair of our Audit Committee.&#160;&#160;Mr. Seagram was President of Sportsco International LP (SkyDome) from February 2001 to March 2003.&#160; From September 1996 to May 1997, Mr. Seagram was President and Chief Executive Officer of Molson Inc. (now MolsonCoors), a company he had previously served for 24 years in a variety of senior management positions.&#160; From October 1992 to August 1996, Mr. Seagram was Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Air Liquide Canada, Inc., a producer of industrial gases.&#160; Mr. Seagram is Chairman of the Toronto Symphony Foundation, a trustee of Trinity College School and the Toronto Symphony Foundation, and he is a director of Harbourfront Foundation.&#160; He has served on the advisory board of the Faculty of Applied Science and Engineering, University of Toronto and INSEAD, Fontainebleau, France. He is a former director of the Toronto Economic Development Corporation (TEDCO).
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Alexander is a Director and member of the Audit Committee of Critical Outcome Technologies Inc., and has served as the Chief Financial Officer of various Canadian public companies for 16 years. Mr. Alexander was formerly lead director and chair of the Audit Committee of Saxon Financial Inc. Mr. Alexander served as a director of Stuart Energy from 2003 to January 2005. From 1999 to 2004, Mr. Alexander was Executive Vice President and Chief Financial Officer of Trojan Technologies Inc., an international environmental high technology company. Mr. Alexander is a Chartered Accountant and is a member of the Institute of Chartered Accountants in Scotland and Ontario. He is also a Chartered Director, having graduated from the Director&#8217;s College, a joint venture between McMaster University and the Conference Board of Canada.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PN" STYLE="PAGE-BREAK-AFTER: ALWAYS; WIDTH: 100%">
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: RIGHT; WIDTH: 100%">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Page 64
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" NOSHADE SIZE="4">
</DIV>

<A NAME="eolPage68"></A>
<DIV ID="HDR">
<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hydrogenics Corporation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Mr. Cardiff is the Chief Operating Officer of SAP Canada. Prior to holding that position, Mr. Cardiff held numerous senior positions in a number of technology companies including large multinationals such as EDS and IBM as well as startup companies such as Fincentric, Convergent Technologies, Tandem, and Stratus Computer. Mr. Cardiff is currently a director of Medic Alert. Mr. Cardiff has also served as a director of Burntsand Inc., Descartes Systems Group, Husky Injection Molding Systems, Solcorp, Visible Genetics, Spectra Security Software Visible Decisions and the Toronto Film Festival, Roy Thomson Hall. Mr. Cardiff has received many awards including &#8220;A Canadian Export Life Time Achievement Award.&#8221; In 1998, Mr. Cardiff was named one of Canada&#8217;s &#8220;Top 40 Under 40,&#8221; recognizing him as one of the nation&#8217;s most successful young leaders. Mr. Cardiff is a member of, and holds the ICD.d designation from, the Institute of Corporate Directors.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Audit Committee charter requires each member of the Audit Committee to be unrelated and independent, and the composition of the Audit Committee satisfy the independence, experience and financial expertise requirements of the Nasdaq, the TSX and Section 10A of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934 (United States), as amended by the Sarbanes-Oxley Act of 2002 (United States), and the rules promulgated thereunder.&#160;&#160;Accordingly, all committee members are required to be financially literate or be willing and able to acquire the necessary knowledge quickly. Financial literacy means the person has the ability to read and understand financial statements that present a breadth and level of complexity of accounting issues that are generally comparable to the breadth and complexity of the issues that can reasonably be expected to be raised by our consolidated financial statements. We believe all of the current members of the Audit Committee are financially literate.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In addition, the Audit Committee charter contains independence requirements that each committee member must satisfy each current member meets those requirements. Specifically, the charter provides that no member of the committee may be an officer or retired officer of Hydrogenics and each member must be independent of Hydrogenics within the meaning of all applicable laws, rules and regulations and any other relevant consideration, including laws, rules and regulations particularly applicable to Audit Committee members.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	The Audit Committee has a policy restricting the provision of non-audit services by our auditors. Any such services must be permitted engagements as provided by the Audit Committee charter and must be pre-approved by the Audit Committee.&#160;&#160;The Audit Committee also pre-approves audit services and the related fees.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	EMPLOYEES
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2012, we employed approximately 145 full-time staff.&#160;&#160;Our full-time staff is divided between 83 full-time staff in our OnSite Generation business, 58 full-time staff in our Power Systems business, and four full-time staff in our Corporate Services group. As of December 31, 2012, four of our employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario corporate headquarters, 49 employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario Power Systems group, nine employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario OnSite generation group, nine employees were located in our Gladbeck, Germany power generation group and 74 employees were located in our Oevel-Westerlo, Belgium OnSite generation group.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2011, we employed approximately 118 full-time staff.&#160;&#160;Our full-time staff was divided between 60 full-time staff in our OnSite Generation business, 54 full-time staff in our Power Systems business, and four full-time staff in our Corporate Services group. As of December 31, 2011, four of our employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario corporate headquarters, 45 employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario Power Systems group, seven employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario OnSite generation group, nine employees were located in our Gladbeck, Germany power generation group and 53 employees were located in our Oevel-Westerlo, Belgium OnSite generation group.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 8PT">
	&#160;
</FONT>
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: CENTER; WIDTH: 100%">

<A NAME="eolPage69"></A>

<DIV ID="GLHDR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="RIGHT">

<DIV>
<DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-STYLE: ITALIC; DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Hydrogenics Corporation
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="RIGHT">
<HR STYLE="COLOR: BLACK" ALIGN="LEFT" NOSHADE SIZE="1" WIDTH="100%">
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As at December 31, 2010, we employed approximately 114 full-time staff.&#160;&#160;Our full-time staff was divided between 63 full-time staff in our OnSite Generation business, 53 full-time staff in our Power Systems business, and four full-time staff in our Corporate Services group. As of December 31, 2010, four of our employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario corporate headquarters, 47 employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario Power Systems group, eight employees were located in our Mississauga, Ontario OnSite generation group, nine employees were located in our Gladbeck, Germany power generation group and 55 employees were located in our Oevel-Westerlo, Belgium OnSite generation group.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Our ability to attract, motivate and retain qualified personnel is critical to our success.&#160;&#160;We attempt to align the interests of our employees with those of shareholders through the use of incentive stock options and a performance based compensation structure.&#160;&#160;A majority of employees own our common shares or options to purchase our common shares.&#160;&#160;We have entered into non-disclosure and confidentiality agreements with key management personnel and with substantially all employees.&#160;&#160;None of our employees are represented by a collective bargaining agreement and we believe our relations with our employees are good.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>

<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;

</FONT>
</DIV>

</TABLE>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	MAJOR SHAREHOLDERS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT" ALIGN="JUSTIFY">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	To the knowledge of our directors and officers, as of February 28, 2013, no person or company beneficially owns, directly or indirectly, or exercises control or direction over common shares carrying more than 5% of the voting rights attached to our outstanding common shares other than CommScope which owns 2,186,906 common shares, representing 28.1% of our outstanding common shares; Enbridge which owns 1,082,251 common shares, representing 13.9% of our outstanding common shares; and General Motors Holdings LLC which owns 454,560 common shares, representing 5.9% of our outstanding common shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	Our major shareholders do not have voting rights different from those of our other shareholders.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY">
<FONT STYLE="FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	See &#8220;Item 10. Additional Information &#8211; Material Contracts&#8221; for information regarding changes in ownership interests of CommScope since it first purchased common shares from the Company in 2010.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of December 31, 2012, approximately 256 US shareholders held approximately 7,775,540 common shares or approximately 100% of our outstanding common shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As of February 28, 2013, approximately 255 US shareholders held approximately 7,870,540 common shares or approximately 100% of our outstanding common shares.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">

</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	RELATED PARTY TRANSACTIONS
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
	&#160;
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT; FONT-WEIGHT: BOLD">
	Transactions with Viking Engineering&#160;&amp; Tool Co.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV STYLE="TEXT-ALIGN: JUSTIFY; TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; DISPLAY: BLOCK; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	In the normal course of operations, we subcontract certain machining and sheet metal fabrication of parts to Viking Engineering&#160;&amp; Tool Co., a company owned by the father and uncle of Joseph Cargnelli, a director and senior officer of the Company and one of our principal shareholders. For the fiscal year ended December&#160;31, 2012, billings by this related company totalled $0.3 million, an increase of $0.2 million from the $0.1 million billed in the year ended December 31, 2011. For the fiscal year ended December&#160;31, 2011, billings by this related company totalled $0.1 million, a decrease of $0.1 million from the $0.2 million billed in the year ended December 31, 2010. At December&#160;31, 2012, and February 28, 2013 we had an accounts payable balance due to this related company of $0.1 million and less than $0.1 million, respectively. We believe that transactions with this company are consistent with those we have with unrelated third parties.
</FONT>
</DIV>
<DIV ID="PGBRK" STYLE="TEXT-INDENT: 0PT; MARGIN-LEFT: 0PT; MARGIN-RIGHT: 0PT">
<DIV ID="FTR">
<DIV ID="GLFTR" STYLE="WIDTH: 100%" ALIGN="LEFT">

<FONT STYLE="DISPLAY: INLINE; FONT-FAMILY: TIMES NEW ROMAN; FONT-SIZE: 10PT">
	As a result of CommScope&#8217;s investments in the Corporation in 2010, CommScope became a related party. For the fiscal year ended December&#160;31, 2012, billings to this related company totalled $0.6 million, an increase of $0.4 million from the $0.2 million billed the year ended December 31, 2011. For the fiscal year ended December&#160;31, 2011, billings to this related company totalled $0.2 million, an increase of $0.1 million from the $0.1 million billed the year ended December 31, 2010. At December&#160;31, 2011 and February 28, 2013, we had an accounts receivable balance from this related company of $nil and $0.2 million, respectively. Billings by this related party for product totalled $8 in the year ended December 31, 2012. Billings by this related party for product totalled $nil in the year ended December 31, 2011. At December 31, 2012 and February 28, 2013, the Corporation has an accounts payable balance to this related party of $nil and $nil, respectively. See &#8220;Item 10. Additional Information &#8211; Material Contracts&#8221; for information regarding amendments to material agreements between the Corporation and Commscope.
